recipes.name: Wiener Schnitzel
recipes.description: Classic Austrian-German breaded veal cutlet, fried to golden perfection. Crispy outside, tender inside.

steps.instruction: Pound veal cutlets between plastic wrap until very thin (about 5mm).
Season cutlets with salt and pepper.
Set up breading station: flour, beaten eggs, breadcrumbs in separate dishes.
Dredge each cutlet in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Heat butter and oil in large pan. Fry schnitzels until golden, 3-4 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges.

tips: Veal should be very thin for authentic texture
Don't press breadcrumbs - they should stay loose for crispy coating
Use a mix of butter and oil to prevent burning

recipes.name: Bratwurst with Sauerkraut
recipes.description: Juicy German sausages served with tangy fermented cabbage. Classic beer garden fare.

steps.instruction: Slice onion and apple. Melt butter in large pan.
Sauté onion until soft. Add apple and cook 2 minutes.
Add sauerkraut, beer, caraway, and bay leaves. Simmer 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, grill or pan-fry bratwurst until golden and cooked through.
Nestle bratwurst into sauerkraut.
Serve with German mustard and crusty bread.

tips: Don't rinse sauerkraut for authentic tangy flavor
Beer adds depth - use a lager or pilsner
Apple balances the acidity

recipes.name: German Potato Salad
recipes.description: Warm potato salad with bacon and tangy vinegar dressing. No mayo, pure flavor.

steps.instruction: Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and slice while warm.
Dice bacon and fry until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until soft.
Add vinegar, broth, mustard, sugar. Bring to simmer.
Pour warm dressing over potatoes. Toss gently.
Add bacon and parsley. Season and serve warm.

tips: Use waxy potatoes - they hold shape better
Dress potatoes while warm for better absorption
Best served at room temperature

recipes.name: Käsespätzle
recipes.description: German-style mac and cheese with soft egg noodles and caramelized onions. Ultimate comfort food.

steps.instruction: Mix flour, eggs, milk, nutmeg, salt until smooth batter. Rest 15 minutes.
Slice onions thinly. Caramelize in butter over low heat for 20 minutes.
Boil large pot of salted water. Press batter through spätzle maker or colander.
Cook spätzle until they float. Drain well.
Layer spätzle with grated cheeses in buttered dish. Keep warm in oven.
Top with crispy onions and chives. Serve immediately.

tips: Batter should be thick but pourable
Work in batches to prevent overcrowding
Onions must be deeply caramelized for authentic flavor

recipes.name: Currywurst
recipes.description: Iconic Berlin street food - sliced sausage with curry ketchup sauce. Quick and satisfying.

steps.instruction: Mix ketchup, curry powder, Worcestershire, paprika, cayenne, and sugar for sauce.
Heat oil in pan. Cook sausages until browned and cooked through.
Warm curry sauce in small pan.
Slice sausages into bite-sized pieces.
Pour curry sauce over sausages.
Sprinkle extra curry powder on top. Serve with fries.

tips: Use a mix of sweet and hot curry powder
Sauce can be made ahead and stored
Traditionally served with a small wooden fork

recipes.name: Kartoffelpuffer
recipes.description: Crispy German potato pancakes. Golden, crunchy, and irresistible.

steps.instruction: Peel and grate potatoes. Squeeze out excess moisture in towel.
Grate onion and add to potatoes.
Mix in eggs, flour, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil in pan until shimmering.
Drop spoonfuls of mixture, flatten. Fry until golden, 3-4 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with applesauce or sour cream.

tips: Remove as much moisture as possible for crispy pancakes
Don't flip too early - let them get golden
Serve immediately for best crunch

recipes.name: Paella Valenciana
recipes.description: Iconic Spanish rice dish with saffron, chicken, and seafood. A celebration in a pan.

steps.instruction: Steep saffron in warm stock. Season and brown chicken pieces. Remove.
Sauté chorizo until fat renders. Add peppers, beans, garlic.
Add grated tomatoes and paprika. Cook until thick.
Add rice, stir to coat. Pour in saffron stock. Do not stir after this.
Arrange chicken on top. Simmer 15 minutes. Add seafood, cover.
Cook until rice is done and socarrat forms. Rest 5 minutes. Serve with lemon.

tips: Don't stir after adding stock - this creates the socarrat (crispy bottom)
Use authentic Spanish rice varieties
Saffron is essential - don't substitute

recipes.name: Gazpacho
recipes.description: Chilled Spanish tomato soup. Refreshing summer classic from Andalusia.

steps.instruction: Soak bread in cold water for 5 minutes.
Roughly chop tomatoes, cucumber, pepper, and garlic.
Blend vegetables with soaked bread until smooth.
With blender running, drizzle in olive oil and vinegar.
Season with salt. Strain for silky texture if desired.
Chill at least 2 hours. Serve with diced vegetables on top.

tips: Use the ripest tomatoes possible
Must be well chilled before serving
Sherry vinegar is traditional - don't substitute

recipes.name: Patatas Bravas
recipes.description: Crispy fried potatoes with spicy tomato sauce and aioli. Essential Spanish tapas.

steps.instruction: Cut potatoes into rough 2cm cubes. Parboil for 5 minutes. Drain well.
Make bravas sauce: sauté garlic, add tomato paste, paprika, cayenne, water. Simmer.
Make aioli: mix mayo with minced garlic and lemon juice.
Heat oil. Fry potatoes until golden and crispy.
Drain potatoes on paper towels. Season with salt.
Drizzle with bravas sauce and aioli. Serve immediately.

tips: Parboiling ensures fluffy interior
Oil must be hot enough for crispy exterior
Serve immediately - they lose crunch quickly

recipes.name: Spanish Tortilla
recipes.description: Classic Spanish potato omelette. Simple ingredients, perfect technique.

steps.instruction: Slice potatoes and onion thinly. Season with salt.
Slowly fry potatoes and onions in olive oil until very soft (not crispy).
Drain oil (save it!). Beat eggs well and mix with potato-onion mixture.
Heat 2 tbsp reserved oil in non-stick pan. Pour in mixture.
Cook on medium-low until bottom is set. Flip using plate.
Cook other side. Slide onto plate. Rest 5 minutes before cutting.

tips: Potatoes must be soft, not crispy
Low and slow cooking for custardy texture
Use a plate slightly larger than the pan to flip

recipes.name: Gambas al Ajillo
recipes.description: Sizzling garlic shrimp in olive oil. Classic Spanish tapas in minutes.

steps.instruction: Peel and devein prawns. Pat dry. Season with salt.
Slice garlic thinly. Break dried chilies into pieces.
Heat olive oil in terracotta dish or skillet until shimmering.
Add garlic and chili. Cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add prawns. Cook 2 minutes per side until pink.
Add sherry (optional), paprika, parsley. Serve immediately with bread.

tips: Use a terracotta dish for authentic presentation
Don't overcook prawns - they get rubbery
Have bread ready to soak up the oil

recipes.name: Churros con Chocolate
recipes.description: Crispy fried dough with thick hot chocolate for dipping. Spanish breakfast treat.

steps.instruction: Boil water with butter, sugar, salt. Remove from heat, add flour. Stir vigorously.
Transfer dough to piping bag with star tip.
Heat oil to 180°C. Pipe 10cm churros directly into oil.
Fry until golden, turning once. About 4 minutes total.
Drain and roll in cinnamon sugar while hot.
Make chocolate: heat milk with chocolate and cornstarch until thick. Serve for dipping.

tips: Dough should be smooth and pipeable
Star tip creates ridges for crispy texture
Spanish hot chocolate is thick - more like pudding

recipes.name: Hungarian Goulash
recipes.description: Rich paprika beef stew, the national dish of Hungary. Warming and deeply flavorful.

steps.instruction: Cut beef into 3cm cubes. Dice onions. Slice peppers.
Brown beef in batches in hot lard. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onions until golden. Remove from heat, add paprika quickly.
Return beef. Add tomatoes, peppers, garlic, caraway. Cover with broth.
Simmer covered for 1.5 hours until beef is almost tender.
Add cubed potatoes. Cook 30 more minutes. Adjust seasoning.

tips: Use authentic Hungarian paprika - it's essential
Add paprika off heat to prevent burning
Should be more stew than soup - not too thin

recipes.name: Chicken Paprikash
recipes.description: Creamy Hungarian chicken in paprika sauce. Comfort food at its finest.

steps.instruction: Season chicken with salt. Dice onions finely.
Sauté onions in lard until soft and translucent.
Remove from heat. Stir in paprika quickly.
Add chicken, tomato, pepper, and broth. Cover and simmer 35-40 minutes.
Remove chicken. Mix flour into sour cream, stir into sauce.
Simmer until thickened. Return chicken. Serve over nokedli or rice.

tips: Use bone-in chicken for more flavor
Temper sour cream with hot liquid before adding to prevent curdling
Sweet paprika is traditional, add hot paprika for heat

recipes.name: Lángos
recipes.description: Hungarian fried bread topped with sour cream and cheese. Irresistible street food.

steps.instruction: Mix warm milk, yeast, and sugar. Let sit 5 minutes until foamy.
Combine flour and salt. Add yeast mixture. Knead until smooth.
Cover and let rise for 1 hour until doubled.
Divide into 6 pieces. Stretch each into flat oval shape.
Heat oil to 180°C. Fry lángos until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Drain. Rub with garlic, top with sour cream and cheese.

tips: Dough should be soft and slightly sticky
Stretch thin in center, thicker at edges
Serve immediately while hot and crispy

recipes.name: Lecsó
recipes.description: Hungarian pepper and tomato stew. Simple, colorful, and delicious.

steps.instruction: Slice peppers into strips. Dice onion. Chop tomatoes.
Sauté onion in lard until soft and golden.
Remove from heat, add paprika. Stir quickly.
Add peppers. Cook covered for 10 minutes until softened.
Add tomatoes and sugar. Simmer uncovered until thickened.
Season with salt. Serve hot with bread or eggs.

tips: Use sweet yellow Hungarian peppers if available
Can add sliced sausage or eggs for protein
Better the next day after flavors meld

recipes.name: Túrós Csusza
recipes.description: Hungarian pasta with cottage cheese, sour cream, and crispy bacon. Ultimate comfort.

steps.instruction: Cook noodles in salted water until al dente. Drain.
Cut bacon into small pieces. Fry until crispy.
Remove bacon, leaving fat in pan.
Toss hot noodles with bacon fat.
Layer noodles with cottage cheese and sour cream.
Top with crispy bacon. Serve immediately.

tips: Use fresh, creamy cottage cheese
Bacon should be very crispy for contrast
Some serve with sugar sprinkled on top

recipes.name: Bruschetta
recipes.description: Toasted Italian bread topped with fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil. Simple perfection.

steps.instruction: Dice tomatoes. Drain excess juice. Place in bowl.
Add minced garlic, torn basil, oil, vinegar, salt, pepper. Mix.
Let tomato mixture sit for 10 minutes for flavors to meld.
Slice bread diagonally. Brush with olive oil.
Toast or grill bread until golden and crispy.
Rub toast with cut garlic. Top with tomato mixture. Serve immediately.

tips: Use the ripest tomatoes you can find
Bread must be very crispy to hold topping
Top just before serving to keep bread crunchy

recipes.name: Minestrone Soup
recipes.description: Hearty Italian vegetable soup with beans and pasta. Nutritious and comforting.

steps.instruction: Dice all vegetables into similar-sized pieces.
Sauté onion, carrots, celery in olive oil until soft.
Add garlic, zucchini, green beans, cabbage. Cook 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes, broth, beans, herbs, parmesan rind. Simmer 30 minutes.
Add pasta. Cook until tender.
Season. Serve with grated parmesan and olive oil drizzle.

tips: Use whatever vegetables are in season
Parmesan rind adds umami - don't skip it
Soup thickens as it sits - add more broth when reheating

recipes.name: Tiramisu
recipes.description: Classic Italian coffee-flavored dessert with mascarpone and ladyfingers. No-bake elegance.

steps.instruction: Separate eggs. Beat yolks with sugar until thick and pale.
Fold mascarpone into yolk mixture until smooth.
Beat egg whites to stiff peaks. Fold into mascarpone mixture.
Mix cooled espresso with Marsala. Quickly dip ladyfingers.
Layer: dipped ladyfingers, mascarpone cream. Repeat.
Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Dust with cocoa before serving.

tips: Don't over-soak ladyfingers - quick dip only
Mascarpone should be at room temperature
Best made a day ahead for flavors to develop

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
recipes.description: Simple Italian salad of tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil. Summer on a plate.

steps.instruction: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella into equal thickness rounds.
Arrange alternating slices on serving plate.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between slices.
Drizzle generously with olive oil.
Season with flaky salt and fresh cracked pepper.
Drizzle balsamic glaze if using. Serve immediately.

tips: Use the best quality ingredients - there's nowhere to hide
Tomatoes and cheese should be room temperature
Buffalo mozzarella is traditional and best

recipes.name: Rindsgulasch
recipes.description: Austrian-German beef goulash, richer and thicker than Hungarian version.

steps.instruction: Cut beef into 3cm cubes. Slice onions thinly.
Slowly cook onions in lard until deeply golden, about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat. Add paprika and tomato paste. Stir quickly.
Add beef, vinegar, broth, caraway, marjoram, garlic.
Cover and simmer very gently for 2-2.5 hours until beef is very tender.
Add lemon zest. Adjust seasoning. Sauce should be thick.

tips: Onions must be well caramelized for depth
Low and slow is key - never boil
Better the next day

recipes.name: Albondigas
recipes.description: Spanish meatballs in rich tomato sauce. Tapas bar essential.

steps.instruction: Mix meat with breadcrumbs, egg, half the garlic, parsley, salt, pepper.
Roll into walnut-sized balls.
Brown meatballs in oil. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion and remaining garlic. Add paprika.
Add wine, tomatoes. Simmer 10 minutes.
Return meatballs. Simmer 15 minutes until cooked through.

tips: Don't overmix the meat - keeps balls tender
Use a mix of beef and pork for flavor
Serve sauce with crusty bread to mop up
